## DecodedTile interface

This object has geometry data in the form of geometries buffers ready to be used by WebGL. These geometries are not `three.js` objects. They are pure data stored as `ArrayBuffer`<!-- -->s and metadata describing these buffers.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface DecodedTile 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [boundingBox](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.boundingbox.md) | [OrientedBox3](./harp-geoutils.orientedbox3.md) | The default bounding box in \[\[Tile\]\] is based on the geo box of the tile. For data-sources that have 3d data this is not sufficient so the data-source can provide a more accurate bounding box once the data is decoded. |
|  [copyrightHolderIds](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.copyrightholderids.md) | string\[\] | Tile data Copyright holder identifiers.<code>id</code>s should be unique. It is recommended to build them from unique identifiers like registered domain names. \[\[CopyrightInfo\]\] |
|  [decodeTime](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.decodetime.md) | number |  |
|  [geometries](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.geometries.md) | [Geometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.geometry.md)<!-- -->\[\] |  |
|  [maxGeometryHeight](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.maxgeometryheight.md) | number | Data sources not defining a bounding box may define alternatively a maximum geometry height in meters. The bounding box of the resulting tile will be extended to encompass this height. |
